hints.content:
Mr. Loy had  to fix $\purpleD{74}$ bikes. He fixed $\blueE{14}$ kids'  bikes.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cedb6d4fc433072f343bd857169e0922022524c5)

$\purpleD{74}-\blueE{14}=\maroonD{60}$

There were $\maroonD{60}$ bikes left to fix after Mr. Loy fixed the kids' bikes.

Then Mr. Loy fixed $\tealE{25}$ adult bikes.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/498161217ba9c708c622be6049a897e5ea0e0454)

$\maroonD{60}-\tealE{25}=\goldE{35}$
Mr. Loy has $\goldE{35}$ bikes left to fix.

question.content:
Mr. Loy fixes bikes for a living. This month, he plans to fix $74$ bikes. So far, he has fixed $14$ kids' bikes and $25$ adults' bikes.

**How many bikes does Mr. Loy still have to fix?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] bikes
